thread.title: Oops: Fox’s Julie Roginsky Says Baldwin’s Russian ‘Make America Great Again’ Hat is Mistranslated
thread.title_full: Oops: Fox’s Julie Roginsky Says Baldwin’s Russian ‘Make America Great Again’ Hat is Mistranslated

author: Ken Meyer
title: Oops: Fox’s Julie Roginsky Says Baldwin’s Russian ‘Make America Great Again’ Hat is Mistranslated
text:
Oops: Fox’s Julie Roginsky Says Baldwin’s Russian ‘Make America Great Again’ Hat is Mistranslated by Ken Meyer | 8:21 pm, January 7th, 2017 
Fox News contributor and native Russian speaker Julie Roginsky says that Alec Baldwin got it wrong with his new hat for mocking President-elect Donald Trump. 
Before she became a Democratic strategist and a regular on Fox’s Outnumbered , Roginsky spent several years of her childhood living in Moscow. This evening, Roginsky took notice of a Mediaite piece which reported on an Instagram photo of Baldwin wearing a Russian lampoon of Trump’s “Make America Great Again” hats. A photo posted by Alec Baldwin (@iamabfalecbaldwin) on Jan 6, 2017 at 8:26am PST 
While various outlets picked up on how Baldwin’s hat has all the standard qualities of Trump’s hats, Roginsky pointed out that the translation wasn’t quite correct. Sigh, Alec Baldwin… that hat is both grammatically incorrect and is more about making America groovy again. https://t.co/86xmaX6HAA 
— Julie Roginsky (@julieroginsky) January 8, 2017 
Mediaite reached out to Roginsky for her translation, and we have received a response: The grammatical declensions of the words are all wrong and the word for "great" is better translated as "awesome" or "groovy." https://t.co/0cYQ7wDwFt 
— Julie Roginsky (@julieroginsky) January 8, 2017 
[Image via screengrab]
